communication_tips.do: Ask open-ended questions about their interests or situation
communication_tips.dont: Use generic pickup lines or immediate compliments on appearance
communication_tips.example_good: I noticed you're reading [book name]. What made you pick that? I've been looking for something new.
communication_tips.example_bad: Did it hurt when you fell from heaven?
communication_tips.context: First interactions, bars, coffee shops, social events

communication_tips.do: Ask follow-up questions based on what they said, remember details
communication_tips.dont: Interrupt to share your own story, or wait for your turn to talk
communication_tips.example_good: You mentioned you love hiking‚Äîwhat's your favorite trail you've done recently?
communication_tips.example_bad: Oh hiking? Yeah, I went to this one place last summer...[long story]

communication_tips.do: Share genuine thoughts and experiences at appropriate depth
communication_tips.dont: Overshare personal trauma or stay completely surface-level
communication_tips.example_good: I've been trying to figure out what I want next in my career. It's exciting but also a bit scary.
communication_tips.example_bad: My ex totally destroyed my trust and now I have commitment issues.

communication_tips.do: Use light-hearted humor about shared experiences or innocent traits
communication_tips.dont: Mock insecurities, physical appearance, or things they value
communication_tips.example_good: Of course you're a cat person‚ÄîI should have guessed from your independent vibe!
communication_tips.example_bad: Wow, you're actually terrible at pool. Like, impressively bad.
communication_tips.context: After rapport is established, avoid on first dates

communication_tips.do: Be clear and direct about wanting to see them again
communication_tips.dont: Play games, wait arbitrary days, or be vague
communication_tips.example_good: I had a great time tonight. I'd love to take you to [specific place] this weekend if you're free.
communication_tips.example_bad: Yeah so...maybe we could hang out sometime or whatever.
communication_tips.context: End of positive dates, when interest is mutual

communication_tips.do: Match their energy level and response time generally
communication_tips.dont: Send walls of text, over-analyze response times, or use excessive emojis
communication_tips.example_good: Hey! That restaurant you mentioned sounds amazing. Free Saturday?
communication_tips.example_bad: Heyyyy üòäüòä So I was thinking about what you said about thai food and there are SO many places we could go I found like 5 options what do you think? ü§îüòãüçú

communication_tips.do: Accept gracefully, thank them for their honesty, move on
communication_tips.dont: Demand explanations, try to change their mind, or insult them
communication_tips.example_good: I appreciate you being honest with me. Thanks for the time we shared‚Äîgood luck out there!
communication_tips.example_bad: Really? After all the effort I put in? You're making a mistake.

body_language.meaning: Interest and engagement; 3+ seconds indicates attraction
body_language.how_to_use: Maintain 60-70% eye contact during conversation; hold gaze briefly when they're speaking
body_language.common_mistake: Staring too intensely (creepy) or avoiding eye contact entirely (disinterest/insecurity)

body_language.meaning: Receptiveness and confidence; facing toward someone with uncrossed arms
body_language.how_to_use: Face your body toward them, keep arms uncrossed, lean slightly forward when interested
body_language.common_mistake: Crossing arms (defensive), turned away body (disinterest), slouching (low confidence)

body_language.meaning: Subconscious sign of rapport and connection
body_language.how_to_use: Subtly match their posture, gestures, and speaking pace after rapport is building
body_language.common_mistake: Mimicking too obviously or immediately (weird), not naturally at all (rigid)

body_language.meaning: Warmth and approachability; Duchenne smile reaches the eyes
body_language.how_to_use: Smile naturally when greeting and during pleasant moments; let it reach your eyes
body_language.common_mistake: Forced smile (uncomfortable), smiling too much (approval-seeking), neutral expression (cold)

body_language.meaning: Comfort level and interest; gradually decreasing distance
body_language.how_to_use: Respect initial personal space, allow natural opportunities for light touch (arm, shoulder)
body_language.common_mistake: Standing too close too soon (invasive), zero physical contact (platonic vibe)

body_language.meaning: Often a sign of nervousness or preening (showing interest)
body_language.how_to_use: Don't fidget excessively, but natural grooming adjustments are fine

body_language.meaning: Subconscious indicator of engagement; feet point toward interest
body_language.how_to_use: Position your body and feet toward them during conversation
body_language.common_mistake: Feet pointing away or toward exit (wanting to leave), not noticing their foot direction

body_language.meaning: Energy level and emotional state; attraction often increases vocal animation
body_language.how_to_use: Speak clearly, vary your tone, avoid monotone delivery
body_language.common_mistake: Speaking too fast (nervous), too slow (boring), or too quiet (uncertain)

situational: This place has great energy. Have you been here before?
I'm trying to decide between [two things]‚Äîwhich would you choose?
You seem like someone who'd have a good recommendation for [relevant topic]
interest_based: That's a cool [item they have]. Are you into [related activity]?
I overheard you talking about [topic]‚ÄîI've been curious about that too
direct: Hi, I'm [name]. I thought you seemed interesting and wanted to introduce myself.
I noticed you from across the room and had to come say hello.
This might be forward, but I'd love to buy you a coffee and chat.

common_mistakes.why_it_fails: Signals self-centeredness and lack of interest in them
common_mistakes.fix: Follow the 60/40 rule: let them talk 60% of the time
Share genuine opinions respectfully, even if different

common_mistakes.why_it_fails: Comes across as insecure and boastful
common_mistakes.fix: Let accomplishments come up naturally; be humble

common_mistakes.why_it_fails: Violates comfort zones and signals only physical interest
common_mistakes.fix: Pay attention to reciprocation; match their pace
Maintain your life, interests, and boundaries

common_mistakes.why_it_fails: Creates negative associations and suggests emotional baggage
common_mistakes.fix: Keep early interactions positive; save venting for later

escalation_tips.actions: Exchange names, find common ground, light humor, maintain engagement
escalation_tips.green_lights: Sustained eye contact, laughing, asking questions back, open body language

escalation_tips.actions: Suggest specific plan, get phone number, follow up within 24 hours
escalation_tips.green_lights: Enthusiasm about meeting again, giving contact info readily, suggesting times

escalation_tips.actions: Choose engaging activity, share personal stories, show genuine interest
escalation_tips.green_lights: Date extending beyond planned time, physical proximity decreasing, vulnerability increasing

escalation_tips.actions: Light touches (arm, shoulder), offer hand, respect boundaries
escalation_tips.green_lights: Reciprocating touch, leaning in, maintaining close proximity
